intro: Echioides lutea, commonly known as the yellow sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, often with a rough texture. Echioides lutea is an important plant for pollinators and is often found in desert scrub habitats.
